articles.content:
U.S. and Japanese anti-DPRK moves under fire
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A joint statement condemning the United States and Japan for their anti-DPRK moves was released on Nov. 21 by the Jordanian Workers' Communist Party, the National Action Front Party of Jordan, the Arab Committee for Solidarity with the Korean People and Support to Korea's Reunification, the Arab Center for the Study of Independent Idea in Jordan and the Arab leadership of the International Front against Zionism.
 The statement stressed that the vicious moves of the U.S. and Japan to strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula under the pretexts of nuclear and other issues go to prove that the unfriendly policies of those countries toward the DPRK remain unchanged. 
 It denounced the hostile policy of the U.S. and Japan toward people's Korea and the Korean people as an insult to humankind and strongly urged them to stop the provocation.    
 It expressed belief that the DPRK leadership and people would staunchly struggle to protect its interests and Asian and world security and peace.

articles.title: Greetings to Albanian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Albanian President 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Alfred Moisiu, President of Albania, on the National Day of his country.
 Expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the future, the message wished him success in the work for stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Albanian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Albanian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Albanian Foreign Minister Arta Dade on the National Day of his country.
 Believing that the relations between the two countries would develop in mutual interests, the message wished Albania success in the work to enter the European Union.
